org.zoolu.util

Class BitStringBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zoolu.util.BitStringBuffer

  • public class BitStringBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    Buffer of bit strings. A BitStringBuffer object represents a variable-length string of bits (0 or 1). Bits can be appended to the tail of the string (by means of the method append(BitString) or append(BitStringBuffer)), read from any interval (by means of the method substring(int,int)), or extracted from the head of the string (by means of the method poll(int)).

    The methods are synchronized, so that BitStringBuffer objects are safe for use by multiple threads.

      • length

        public int length()
        Gets the total number of bits.

      • clear

      • append

        Appends a BitString.

      • append

        public BitStringBuffer append(BitStringBuffer bit_buffer)
        Appends a BitStringBuffer.

      • substring

        public BitStringBuffer substring(int begin,
                                 int end)
        Returns a new BitStringBuffer that contains a substring of this BitStringBuffer. The substring begins at the specified index begin and extends to the bit at index end - 1. Thus the length of the substring is end-begin.

      • poll

        public BitStringBuffer poll(int n)
        Retrieves and removes the first n bits of this BitStringBuffer. If L was the length of BitStringBuffer before calling this method, after this method the length of BitStringBuffer is L-n.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of heading bits that have to be retrieved and removed
        Returns:
        a new BitStringBuffer containing the n bits that has been removed (bits from 0 to n-1 of the original BitStringBuffer)

      • toBitString

        public BitString toBitString()
        Gets the BitString of this BitStringBuffer.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of this object.
